text: Seems right.
author: TJRaphael

text: That’s a fair point! I guess I have heard this story many times so that didn’t bother me, mainly through several radio and podcast interviews with John Carreyrou. For me it gave me a lot of additional context that I didn’t have.
author: TJRaphael

text: Ah! Why? I am enjoying it and I think the way that it is shot is great for a doc.
author: TJRaphael

text: @travishelwig thanks for the follow, I’m a big fan!
author: TJRaphael

text: I am probably late here but I am finally watching The Inventor about #Theranos and the composition and cinematography is so beautiful. Bravo @alexgibneyfilm.
author: TJRaphael

text: And then also a video live stream of someone sitting on a mic as someone on the phone talks is not satisfying. And it’s not a podcast or audio experience. The radio infastructure is different.
author: TJRaphael

text: There are lots of challenges with that. Where do you stream? It’d have to be FB/Twitter. And you need guests. NPR has a ton of correspondents, a lot of podcasts don’t and are analysis based. So you would need a whole crew booking.
author: TJRaphael

text: It’s 15 mins of “we don’t know what’s going on yet” and it’s 15 mins. I want continuous coverage rn. The pod could be out of date in 45 mins.
author: TJRaphael

text: It’s days like this where I realize there’s one big limitation podcasts: Big, breaking news. I am glued to the WNYC livestream right now. I know the emergency pods are on the way but I am in need NOW.
author: TJRaphael

text:
Hey Twitter! I’m co-hosting the latest episode of @Slate’s music history podcast, HIT PARADE.

I join @cmolanphy to talk cover songs, the #RockHall2019 inductees, and the legendary Stevie Wonder.

Listen via @Spotify.  https://open.spotify.com/episode/4GXDcfPuw82a8JENXVgds9?si=8YOYlQBUQTe-rHPB8ArN4w …
